name: 近代西方知識分子與中國文化研討
description:
1925年，英國文豪G. K. Chesterton寫道，「中國是唯一真正另類於基督教文明的世界…它是一個我們無法藉傳統之橋而企及的古代…相較於一個頭戴黑色禮帽、與我們對坐在倫敦茶館的中國人，希羅多德反而更像個活人。對比李鴻章之情緒的難以捉摸，我們感覺自己好像其實和大衛、以賽亞心靈相通。」的確，中西文化鴻溝之巨大是顯而易見的，也正因如此，啟蒙運動以來，中國文化便一直是西方思想家、知識分子在摸索社會與文化理想時的重要參照對象。隔著語言與文化的鴻溝，他們對於中國此一「另類文明」的觀察雖時有洞見，但亦充滿誤解；事實上，這些洞見與誤解毋寧反映了西方自身的思想取向。本課程將以近代西方重要知識分子理解中國文化的嘗試為主軸，閱讀相關重要研究與方法討論，並從十八、十九、二十世紀中各挑選一個主題，呈現近代西方主流思想的特質與變遷理路。
       本課程係為有志於從事學術相關工作之大學部/研究所學生而設計，因此，除了引介「近代西方知識分子與中國文化」此一課題，本課程旨在培養修課學生的研究能力，包括：史學的討論與寫作、二手研究的閱讀與分析、對不同研究取徑的覺察與理解。本課程要求修課學生的積極參與，並應具備一定的英文閱讀能力，每周閱讀份量約為20~30頁的英文資料。
goals: 考察近代西方知識分子眼中的中國文化及對中國文化態度之變化
認識近代西方思想的演進
培養學生英語閱讀能力
syllabus:
### 2020.8.27 更新

### _**Part I  脈絡與取徑  (Week 1 ~ Week 5)**_

**Week 1 Introduction**

**Week 2 Contexts I：The History of the Idea of Europe**

讀本：Gerard Delanty, “Europe in the Age of Modernity” in his _Inventing Europe_ (London: Palgrave, 1995), pp. 65-83. 

參考資料：J.G.A. Pocock, “Some Europes in Their History” in Anthony Pagden ed., _The Idea of Europe: From Antiquity to the European Union_ (Cambridge: CUP, 2002), pp. 55-71.

**Week 3 Contexts II：The Changing European Views of China** 

讀本：Jonathan Spence, “Western Perceptions of China from the Late Sixteenth Century to the Present” in Paul S. Ropp ed., _Heritage of China: Contemporary Perspectives on Chinese Civilization_ (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1990), p. 1-14.

**Week 4 Approaches I：Orientalism/Postcolonialism**

讀本：Edward Said, _Orientalism_ (London: Vintage, 1979), pp. 1-9, 31-73. (有中譯本)

**Week 5 Approaches II：Responses to Orientalism/Postcolonialism**

讀本：Jürgen Osterhammel, _Unfabling the East: The Enlightenment's Encounter with Asia_, translated by Robert Savage (Oxford: Princeton University Press, 2018), ch. 1 (pp. 1-33). (有中譯本)

### _**Part II  十八世紀：論啟蒙時期歐洲對中國文化態度的轉變 (Week 6 ~ Week 9)**_

**Week 6  Historiography**

讀本：Stefan Gaasmand Jacobsen, “Chinese Influences or Images? Fluctuating Histories of How Enlightenment Europe Read China”, _Journal of World History_, 24:3 (2013), pp. 623-660. 

**Week 7  General Account**

讀本：Osterhammel, _Unfabling the East_, ch. 13 (pp. 480-517). (有中譯本)

**Week 8  Political Economy and China I: The Scottish Enlightenment**

讀本：

1\. Jeng-Guo Chen, “The British View of Chinese Civilization and the Emergence of Class Consciousness”, _The Eighteenth Century_, 45:2 (2004), pp. 193-205.

2\. A. E. Millar, “Revisiting the Sinophilia/Sinophobia Dichotomy in the European Enlightenment through Adam Smith’s ‘Duties of Government’”, _Asian Journal of Social Science_, 38:5 (2010), pp. 716-737.

**Week 9  Political Economy and China II: Malthus’s theory of population**

讀本：Alison Bashford, “Malthus and China”, _Historical Journal_, 63:1 (2020), pp. 63-89.

參考資料：Duncan Kelly and Shailaja Fennell, “Malthusian Moments: Introduction”, _Historical Journal_, 63:1 (2020), pp. 1-13.

### _**Part III  十九世紀：宗教、科學與帝國主義下的中國 (Week 10 ~ Week 12)**_

**Week 10  General Account**

讀本：

1\. Raymond Dawson, _The Chinese Chameleon: An Analysis of European Conceptions of Chinese Civilization_ (Oxford: OUP, 1967), pp. 132-42. 

2\. D. M. Jones, _The Image of China in Western Social and Political Thought_ (London: Palgrave, 2001), pp. 67-68, 85-98.

**Week 11  Positivism and the Origins of the Idea of “the West”**

讀本：Georgois Varouxakis, “Godfather of Occidentality: Auguste Comte and the Idea of the West”, _Modern Intellectual History_, 16:2, (2019), pp. 411-441.

參考資料：

Georgois Varouxakis, “When Did Britain Join the Occident: On the Origins of the Idea of the West in English”, _History of European Ideas_, 46:5 (2020), pp. 563-581.

**Week 12  International Law, Civilisation and Eastern Nations**

讀本：Jennifer Pitts, “Boundaries of Victorian International Law” in Duncan Bell ed., _Victorian Visions of Global Order_ (Cambridge: CUP, 2008), pp. 67-88. 

### _**Part IV  二十世紀：西方文明危機與東方熱 (Week 13 ~ Week 16)**_

**Week 13  General Account**

讀本：J. J. Clarke, _Oriental Enlightenment_ (London: Routledge, 1997), pp. 95-111, 130-148. 

**Week 14   European Internationalists and Asian Nationalism** 

讀本：Chika Tonooka, “World History’s Eurocentric Moment? British Internationalism in the Age of Asian Nationalism", _Modern Intellectual History_ (2019), pp. 1-26.

**Week 15   Case Study I: Goldsworthy Lowes Dickinson, Modernism and Chinese Culture**

讀本：

1\. Jason Harding, “Goldsworthy Lowes Dickinson and the King's College Mandarins”, _Cambridge Quarterly_, 41:1 (2012), pp. 26-42.

2\. Patricia Laurence, _Lily Briscoe’s Chinese Eyes: Bloomsbury, Modernism, and China_ (South Carolina: South Carolina University Press, 2013), pp. 160-171.

**Week 16   Case Study II : Eileen Power, Feminism, and Chinese Society**

讀本：

1\. Billie Melman, “Under the Western Historian’s Eyes: Eileen Power, and the Early Feminist Encounter with Colonialism”, _History Workshop Journal_, 42 (1996), pp.147-167.

2\. Maxine Berg, _A Woman in History: Eileen Power, 1889-1940_ (Cambridge: CUP, 1996), pp. 99-107. 

### _**Part IV  個人口頭報告 (Week 17~Week 18)**_

grading.note: 就本課程之相關主題(題目需在期中先與授課教師討論)，撰寫一份5000字以上的學期研究作業。

1.	讀本導讀 (15%) 
2.	課堂討論 (15%)：每位同學每週須就當週讀本的論點與英文閱讀，分別準備一個問題。
就個人的學期研究作業，進行20分鐘的口頭報告。
